content:
I'm glad to hear you're enjoying your new earrings! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or interactions, so I didn't help you with earrings last weekend.

Regarding your question, I'd be happy to provide some general recommendations for jewelry stores that sell high-quality pearl studs in downtown areas. Keep in mind that I'm a text-based AI and don't have real-time information about specific store locations or availability. You may want to check online reviews, websites, or visit the stores in person to find the perfect pair.

Here are some well-known jewelry stores that often carry high-quality pearl studs:

1. Tiffany & Co. - Known for their luxurious and high-quality jewelry, Tiffany's often carries a selection of pearl studs.
2. Cartier - This French luxury jeweler offers a range of pearl jewelry, including studs.
3. David Yurman - While they're famous for their cable bracelets, David Yurman also carries a selection of pearl studs.
4. Mikimoto - As a renowned pearl jeweler, Mikimoto offers high-quality pearl studs in various styles and settings.
5. Local Jewelry Boutiques - Consider visiting local, family-owned jewelry boutiques in your downtown area, as they may carry unique, high-quality pearl studs from various designers.

When shopping for pearl studs, make sure to look for:

* High-quality pearls with good luster, surface quality, and color
* Solid metal settings, such as 14k or 18k gold, or platinum
* Secure clasps and sturdy construction
* Certification from organizations like the Gemological Institute of America (GIA) or the International Colored Gemstone Association (ICA)

Remember to try on different pairs, ask questions, and don't hesitate to negotiate prices or ask about any certifications or guarantees. Happy shopping!
